TopicTitle: Mission Control building displaced and missing textures

Articles.Content:
KSP:

  • 0.25 Windows 32 Bit from Steam running on Windows 8.1 64 Bit
  • build id = 00642
    2014-10-07_10-59-44
    Branch: master

Problem: There is a visible gap at one side of the Mission Control building. Building also misses some textures.

Reproduction steps:

  • Build a manned craft in the VAB or SPH and launch it. EVA the Kerbal and walk to the Mission Control building.
  • Walk up the northern stair well (the one facing the runway).

Results:

  • There is a visible gap at the east side and some other parts at the building.
  • The building looks misplaced by 1-2 meters to the west.
  • A Kerbal can stand on the invisible ground.
  • A Kerbal collides with the building walls as it should do (= no walking through walls or hitting invisible walls).
  • All other buildings are placed at the right spots as far as I have seen. It's only the Mission Control building with the errors.
  • The north stair well misses a few textures.
  • The south stair well is fine.

Logs:

link

Screenshots:

There is a small gap in the ground at the south side of the building near the stair well.

At the other side, too.

There is a narrow but long gap in the ground at the east side of the building.

A Kerbal can stand on the invisible ground.

The northern stair well misses a few textures.

This post is a duplicate of this one. As suggested I confirmed the bugs without a modded install. (Thx @ Nathan)
